V3fy6n4iNDztiwHLqPpw0g.text: The food is great. No doubt. The reason for my high rating, however, is not just food. My partner and I were in London for a few days and visited a variety of restaurants over a period of seven days. And we're really disheartened with the quality of service at most restaurants in London. However, this was the first restaurant, where we were asked more than once on how he food was and manager even stopped by. I would rather spend my money where the customer service is good or not eat out at all. And Giraffe definitely did not disappoint us with its service!

F7VY3AEjhWnFSvgMhdKKqg.text: Only went in for cocktails, which were tasty - lychee martinis. Service was helpful...liked that it was casual yet hip and it was perfect to just sit down for a cocktail with friends overlooking the street. The little tables and candles were cute. Not sure what the food is like, I only ate at the one at Heathrow and that was excellent.

_PEdA_W_ABrbPvrEoHUy9g.text: Yes, I'm a fan !Smoothie first to conquer my epic thirst - yes I was out catching up with an old high school friend last night. Delicious, fresh and exactly what I needed.Next it was breakfast quesadilla with eggs and bacon paired with a yummy salsa topped with avocado, mmmmmmmmmmmmmm.I ordered side potatoes and side beans because I'm gluttonous and I needed them both although I didn't really eat them. So yummy, great service, I love it !

P43Qclz2oihzF4Nk9y-AcQ.text: This is my 2nd favorite Giraffe location (Battersea Rise being fave). Always nice service and typical yummy Giraffe fare. A great location if you're going out in Belgravia or meeting up with friends at Victoria station.

zJHGakF4I_kc8kmJ7N5dzQ.text: Giraffe is a bright, breezy joint that should appeal to everyone. Food is a clever mix of world food and filling western comfort staples like cheesecake or, my favourite, the full English fry up. Do yourself a favour and check it out when you're next in Victoria.

3y9vjuHzQQ51LvkDkfo2sA.text: Tasty food and friendly staff! Their menu has a wide range of different foods to choose from. My cheesy garlic bread was a bit cold at first, but they made me a new one in a hurry! So no complaints there Between my starter, giant burger, chips and onion rings, I ate until I could stomach any more! The burger did cost about £9 but was full of flavour and there was a lot of it. I would well recommend Giraffe if you are waiting for a show, bus or train around the Victoria area!

7ATStZlfwnSSVlm1BfQmCQ.text: Funky and fun atmosphere. Great place for a relaxing bite and yum! I had the duck stir fry and it was AMAZING, an explosion of flavor  in my mouth. It was delicious and reasonable enough that it doesn't have to be a special night out to eat their. This place would be great for a girls night.

K61URXih4YMK3rRt06fLQA.text: Went here based on a recommendation and was not disappointed. This is a little funky restaurant with a good sized menu and some really good sandwiches.  I got the rump steak sandwich and not only was it huge, it was delicious!! They also have a yummy cocktail menu if you're looking to grab a drink :)

SoVlN6yquMsTRcI9qyNtdQ.text: I absolutely felt in love with this place. Not only the food is great but the customer service is wonderful. My friend and I are originally from Los Angeles, and we are loud so we sat in the corner near the bar. Although, we spent a long time talking and eating we did not feel out of place like other places usually try kicking you out. This place is great to eat and spend some quality time with friends.

ogNiHOZ3lJXXtOJ4rZmaog.text: I went here with my boyfriend at about 3 pm on a Friday. It wasn't busy, the food came out quickly, and they had a decent amount of vegetarian options. We chose the bruschetta bites, delux falafel burger, and phod malay noodles. For a £10 burger, I'm glad it was as good as it was. Not dry, plenty of toppings, and the choice of sweet potato fries, rather than the regular. My boyfriend ordered the malay noodles, which were too spicy for me.. But he seemed to enjoy them and said the flavor reminded him of samosas. The bruschetta was yummy, although a little wet and cold by the time we returned to our hotel (as expected). Lots of toppings though, which was great.I noticed another review saying they were upset that it wasn't a specific type of cuisine served, but that was honestly my favorite part. We were able to get asian noodles, Italian bruschetta, and a burger in one location.. It's like a delicious, vegetarian sampler!Overall, there were great vegetarian choices, and we would be happy to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Spicy malay noodles
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Falafel burger
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Bruschetta

VzkZHRkO8a55UoAMNL45YA.text: This was a 4 1/2 star experience rounded up.This casual and funky little restaurant was located right near the theater we were waiting to see Wicked at and we decided to get a quick bite before the show. The menu was very reasonably priced and the staff was very friendly and attentive. I ordered the duck stir fry and a strawberry lime cider, which I'm officially in love with. My fella ordered the chicken kiev and an apple cider. All the food was fantastic and filling, the drinks were sublime. First time trying Rekorderlig Cider, but it's addictive! My noodles were very light and flavorful. A great summer dish. My fella's chicken kiev was lightly battered and had just the right seasoning and sauce. Definitely a thumbs up for the food!I definitely recommend this place for a light dinner or drinks before a show or after work. YUM.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

h7hIw6kuezmYTVbWC_oWdg.text: We went to Giraffe on 4/22/17 after a day of sightseeing around London. We shared a 5 tapias appetizer of hummus, Goya, flatbread, chicken and short rib tacos. Every item that we had was delicious and enough for 2. The server suggested a dandelion and burdock (British) drink that was a great choice! Dessert was a waffle topped with a cinnamon banana, vanilla ice cream with chocolate and caramel drizzle-outstanding! Our server Anita was wonderful and we mentioned that to the manager when we left. Yes it was noisy, tables a bit close but nothing to take away from the experience!

sRavlmeBvzh6APNoUNSiRQ.text: First impression... My fiance and I walked into this place 2 minutes before opening. The waitress stated that they aren't open until 11 am (remember we were there 2 minutes before 11). We told her fine, but she seated us anyways. Once seated we looked to our left and there were customers already seated...eating. Whatever the fuck that means. We ordered the full brunch which was ok. Nothing fancy, just good enough for us hungry folks. Other than the odd/somewhat crappy service, everything else was ok.

93rpkoiuHG_D8CgieP_a6Q.text: Eh. This is a tourist trap. London is full of amazing restaurants. This is overpriced for mediocre food.

Khjz2_W--rShKnadrZ28Rg.text: Absolutely splendid. Would go back for their Toastie Deluxe alongside a Hippy Hippy smoothie. So delicious!!!

ElZ-qXW2lZhd3tas9N7mAQ.text: I came here on Friday at 22:00. I was told they were closing early, even though they aren't supposed to close until 23:00. Strangely the server kept saying "guys" even though I was alone and am female. Very confusing experience all around.

iH1Qsv6d0YvAmmJF2AHH1Q.text: Giraffe can nowadays be found in many locations and I just tried the one close to Victoria Station. The food was very good, tasty burger, great salad and also a pretty good selection of both food and drinks. The food is not innovative or gourmet style but they deliver good quality dishes. The variety is also good so most people will be ale to find something they like.Service was friendly and attentive. Food and drinks were also quickly brought to the table so all in all a good experience.

OQpAHseQqMUNYOPYUM4T8Q.text: We arrived at Giraffe around 7pm on a Wednesday. I was surprised to see how busy it was. Luckily, our party of 3 was seated right away.I chose the steak sandwich that came with fries, and my sandwich was delicious. The bread was nice and toasty, the steak was a nice medium well, and the blend of arugula and mayo was perfect. The sandwich also came with caramelized onions, but my dislike for any type of onion had me scraping it off right away.My companions both ordered the chicken schnitzel that came with an arugula salad and either mashed potatoes or fries. The chicken was breaded and flavored with garlic butter. It was good, but a little too buttery for my liking. We ordered 2 different desserts: the chocolate mousse crunch and the apple and cherry crumble. I LOVED the chocolate mouse crunch! It was rich while still being light and airy. The crumble was also good, but the apple and cherry portions weren't as flavorful as I expected. The crumble on top was delicious. It wasn't your run of the mill crumble made of flour, butter, and sugar. This had oats, raisins, slivered almonds, and hazelnuts. I would give this place a 5 star for food, but since the service was so slow, I'm giving them a 4 overall.

ul7pNxEe34wJ6rufGM6-XA.text: Giraffe is a chain restaurant that can't seem to really decide what type of cuisine it would like to offer. To start with, the name suggests absolutely nothing about the cuisine. An English word, a long necked animal. Your guess is as good as mine.I've only ever eaten at a Giraffe twice; once in Heathrow Airport with my parents and the other time at this one here. Neither have been particularly pleasant experiences. The menu offers things from fish and chips, to BBQ ribs, to an asian inspired duck salad. Again, what cuisine is this? I ordered the BBQ ribs, as did my friend Maria and my friend Oscar had the Haddock and chips. It was meh. I didn't finish my ribs as they were incredibly sweet, the sauce was verging on caramel-y, and it was so filling. My main qualm about this branch is the staff. They were rude, dismissive, quite clearly not interested in serving you, and had to ask multiple questions about things we ordered after we'd ordered them. They also, in a chain restaurant selling painfully mediocre quality food, added the 12.5% service charge to the bill. I won't even begin to describe the look of anger and disgust on our waitress's face when we asked if she could take the service charge off. I'd advise you head elsewhere.

XM2jgtZUoj33SYrEmLUD1A.text: We went for desert only. Great service, location & setting, the food was ok too but nothing overly special.

nVeLz02XuHx9EE1A_jqCQw.text: Where to begin...our experience started off well when we walked in the door. We were immediately greeted from across the restaurant by the bartender, and a server (Chris, I believe) sat us and cheerfully took our drink orders. We spent a few minutes looking over the menu, at which point an Eastern European woman marched over and asked us what we wanted to drink. We let her know someone had already taken our order, at which point she left without a word. After our drinks came, she returned to take our food order (clearly Chris has been covering her section of tables, as she had been nowhere to be seen until asking about drinks). Our food arrived in a reasonable time, and our waitress once again disappeared completely. She did not return to check on us or get us more drinks, except to offer dessert and clear our plates about 10 minutes after we had finished. Once we declined dessert, we were completely ignored, and had to flag down the bartender for the check. A word of warning, there was an included "optional" gratuity of 12.5%. Food was okay at best, service was awful.

htJ57m_0npGY76GS1n9YlQ.text: We ate here on a Sunday night, and we were seated right away at a high row of  tables (not my favorite, but my children enjoy them).  They had good drink specials for kids and adults, and the food was fine but not thrilling.  It was family friendly and reasonably priced, but I wouldn't call the food memorable.

m5yjmP58p5GTgFZVNUe1iA.text: I'm a regular visitor to Giraffe, and especially to this branch as it's really handy for work. Especially like going during bar buddies, as you can get some great half price wines and cocktails. Had the herby chicken bun less burger today, which is essentially a grilled herby chicken breast, but was really tasty. Came with a lovely fresh salad with included one of my faves, edamame beans. I added a side of sweet potatoes fries, simply because Giraffe do them so well, making them an unresistable addition.

gdH-hISJJsjAKBe5cflSrA.text: this place was okay. across the street from our hotel so we had to check it out. the fries were very good or chips whatever they call them over there. delicious. the burger not so much. I was very happy they had cranberry juice on the menu though! never see that on a menu besides in a drink.

SqN7W4MnKErsfHtRvn_nng.text: Good breakfast of delicious porridge with fruit, plus a coffee. Very reasonably priced for London ( £7.5 for the porridge plus an Americano and a refill of the coffee), and free wifi via the Cloud.Good service, too -- although I always find it silly/annoying when a 12.5% tip is automatically added to the bill, as it is here.  Can definitely see myself returning.

1lJu8OKw3RVxTGQ03iynUg.text: I went to Giraffe on a recent trip to the UK, during which I traveled alone. I was looking for a place to eat before my show. This place was great and laid back and I didn't feel awkward eating alone there. My steak sandwich was absolutely delicious and so was my drink (which was 50% off during bar buddies)! My waiter was really friendly and attentive and even took some time to chat with me about where I was from. Even though the place was getting busy as I was finishing my meal, they weren't rushing me out the door.

yicB_fzFXuZlK76AySV7bA.text: Went to Giraffe after a long day of touring and it was great.  Sesame Chicken and Pot Sticker appetizers were great. Jerk Chicken and Thai Salad were fantastic. Server and manager were super friendly especially to my daughter who is a giraffe freak.

FC6X0phnl9LWFCWP_Zunrg.text: This is my local go-to restaurant when I'm just looking for a casual meal. Service tends to be on the slow side, but the food is simple and very reasonably priced. Nothing to write home about, but then again you're paying 8 pounds or so for a dish (their Giraffe special= appetizer and main course for 7.95. Marvelous!)I actually rather like the ambiance here - it's pretty busy and happening, yet the lighting of the place is very well done- puts you in a "big city" mood, even though this place is tucked away behind Victoria station! In short, if you are looking for someplace easy with decent food, this is your place.

q4KNL-7g2cMMRkyzgHWP0Q.text: Well we stuck to Wilton Rd for dinner this week and that's how we found Giraffe. Their menu is very diverse so it's great to have such different options. I ordered a plain burger with avocado. I notice they don't ask you how you want it cooked in London but since I like well done, I was fine. My daughter, the medium rare eater, not so much. Only thing I found about my burger was the avocado wasn't ready yet. As someone who eats A LOt of avocado this one wasn't ripe yet. I'm surprised they were able to cut it. My son got the taco tapas and he liked them. My daughter liked her burger. And hubby said his enchiladas were fine. Service was excellent!!! And finished with the churros that were so yummy! Good finish to the end of a long day all over London.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

9wDbk2wFEGJd10-JfSHVzQ.text: How the hell does this place have good reviews? Awful. Customer service is a joke - We had a couple dirty glasses and asked for new ones. The manager took them and gave them back to us as if we were stupid enough to not notice. Most of all, food is gross. Bad quality everything.

rxcs0E-nXobNBrHBtKdAGw.text: Good food, reasonably priced.  Portions are variable.  We ordered from the tapas menu; the tacos were large and delicious.  You get two tacos for each order.  The chorizo sausage was equally tasty, but small, which is fine but the variation makes it difficult to know how much to order.  The happy hour is quite good: cocktails are $5.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Menu

rrYCQNuvno1oEO2LxKPs0w.text: My husband and I stopped in here shortly after 12:00 pm yesterday for lunch quite hungry when we arrived in London. We had eaten at their location st Heathrow and enjoyed it, and were encouraged by the reviews left fellow Yelpers. Alas, we received very inconsistent service. It was a bad start when we sat in a nearly empty restaurant and the waitress came up to us and said after 10 minutes, did you order? I told her that we hadn't even seen menus. She gave us only the breakfast menus. I didn't want breakfast and should have asked if they had a larger menu. I noticed other people were eating other food. I don't know why I was so bashful. Probably was tired from a very long trip and had been awake due to an early morning flight. We each placed our order. When placing mine, we informed our server of my allergies. She said no problem - that the entree didn't have that but she would inform the kitchen. Our plates were our places in front of us and I began eating. Suddenly, one of the waitresses (there was a steady rotation of people at our table rather than someone who was assigned) pulled my plate away saying "Wait! Hold on. I have to check something with the kitchen". My plate was removed and returned to the kitchen. I was told that the corn cakes had potatoes, something to which I am allergic. I had eaten half of one. They said they would make me ones without (they didn't) Five minutes later my plate was returned without the corn cakes and by then the eggs were cold. Had I known that, I would have ordered something else. Again, I wish I was given the full menu. One of the waitresses apologized and comped the dish. Overall, it was a bad experience. I did experience some physical discomfort from having eaten the offending corn cake. For one, I think the staff needs to have better knowledge of the menu. Secondly, I think that they need to have people assigned to tables. It was way to chaotic. There also seems to be an absence of training overall.

nSlkMPoPKI3a9mpoDRCFnw.text: Stopped by for a quick bite - Food was  ok, but the service was slow! Near empty restaurant with most tables reserved... staff not responsive. Had the Stir Fry Duck-- more veggies than meat...

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

XrJ6RLpRsicOcrMjYigBkg.text: The Giraffe is located a quick walk away from Victoria Tube Station. It is a nice restaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating areas. The menu features a lot of great vegatarian options, along with this there are a lot of burgers on the menu. I enjoyed all the food options provided and will definitely be coming back.

FBzLGFCYuaB3IkrdnRWaIQ.text: Yes, i gave it 5 stars.. After walking around all day and seeing all the sights, I was very hungry for a hamburger. Well I had the giraffe burger which was the best burger I have ever eaten. Yes, I am from California, and this was the best. They also have an extensive menu of many foods and they are reasonably priced. The restaurant has outstanding service and is very clean. I actually came here three times for three different menu items. I would always stop here.

KXW7ASul3u1fegYTWCjAWg.text: Arrived early evening without a reservation, promptly seated, & cheerfully greeted. Tasty Enchilada Chicken Tinga and timely service all around.

SGqFMZuutGgkeYkrs7SV-g.text: 15-APR-2018 * 19:30 * DINNER * Extremely wide selection! Tough time choosing between multiple tapas plates or a larger "mains" selection... ended up going with tapas... myself, wife & 2kids... everyone got something different, all was good. Finished off the night with churros for desert. Excellent happy hour...5pm-close. Worked great for the kids...other families dining while we were there! I'd actually like to give a 4.5, but cannot do that here...

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

hdZzS8DDXsB1Tm95bfX-Cw.text: Found this spot near our hotel during our stay in London. Good, affordable and filling breakfast options. It was so good we ended up eating breakfast their each morning during our stay. I would highly recommend it!

jou3UBXnIFw3uyGszzYteA.text: Very nice, surprising restaurant. My wife, daughter and I selected vegetarian burgers. Unfortunately, my daughters' one was quite spicy but still ok. The place was quite crowded on this banking holiday monday. Staff was very busy, managed to give everybody their attention.

RY0v045EiGF0wTCeAyDINA.text: Went for a business breakfast. The food was good, portion sizes good, and the wait staff was really friendly. Only downside was that the place was almost completely empty but the food took quite long to turn up.

gNVjWKOHqpWKNeBkr5DYFg.text: Seriously so amazing! Such a variety of things to choose from! I had the lamb tangine (I think that's how u spell it) and my bf had the chicken Malay curry. Both of them were delicious! And the drinks are FANTASTIC!

28h0893NRQzwxGQPipugfQ.text: Pleasant place with good food and conveniently located near Victoria station. Their lemonade was particularly good.

dy_epSrRPs7xbcbQgyRdOA.text: Excellent place, delicious food and good price. Good for families, couple or to go alone. Perfect service and nice musics.

67Pr4ZF32lbFhzUK-YEqdw.text: I was back today for breakfast with my family. The food was really good but the most important they were so so so nice with my son. If you are looking for a kid friendly place, this is your place!

zG3K0laxLT3pR0_o0b7dBQ.text: I know the food choices around Victoria are limited, but I thought Giraffe was a pretty good find -- especially if you're hunting for food a little later on in the evening! It's a chain, but still has a lot of character all on its own. We were eating pretty late, and this was one of the few decent-looking places still open for dinner. They have a pretty good deal where you can get a starter and a main for under £I0, though the choices are limited. I wasn't feeling any of those and had the rump steak sandwich with chips instead. The steak sandwich was huge! Even though I was starving, I only managed to finish a tasty half. Our waitress was really friendly and our food arrived promptly, so even though they automatically put a service charge on the bill, I didn't mind so much (I guesssss).

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Rump steak sandwich & chips

niIoKJf5AOGDlrpHitQjsA.text: Giraffe is a fun place to try. It can be loud, the tables are very close together, and it can take a bit of time to get your food. BUT, it is a lovely menu, lots of options, and the servers are fantastic.We hit up Giraffe three times on our week long time just for the nachos and sandwhiches.

3ovZBenn_diWD8-PCBFC_w.text: Giraffe is a chain throughout London. This location is nice with a small seating area in front. For families: it has a good children's menu with healthy choices (fresh juices/fruit cups), and not so healthy (items smothered in chocolate chips). We tried a variety of items from the menu including the huevos rancheros, and pancakes. First, the pancakes: the stack is huge (3 large pancakes), and if you opt for a filling (bananas, blueberries or the like), you get smothered cakes! Second: huevos rancheros, we didn't have high standards since we are quite far from the originating culture, but the whole dish was cold (including the eggs). We didn't wait long for food, so we can only assume they were only heated slightly per normal serving. Had the eggs been hot, plus the great sides within the burrito, and copious hot salsa = it would still be far from true Mexican authentic, yet it was fine given the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Huevos rancheros & blueberry stack

wtfisAOeRH_EZ3A1kKHTbw.text: Appetizers and drinks after the show...nachos, not bad (and we're from California, so we know!)   :)- crunchy shrimp, spicy chicken strips all devoured. No draught beers, though listed on menu. Service was very friendly, even though we arrived about s half hour before closing on a Wednesday night. Overall, a solid experience.
